analysis.summary: Vue 3 single-file component that renders an 'events' SVG icon. It exposes a `fill` prop to customize the icon color and forwards any CSS class passed via attributes onto the `<path>` element.
analysis.purpose: Provide a reusable, customizable SVG icon for 'events' in the martyrs icon library.

components.name: IconEvents
responsibilities: Render an 80Ã—80 SVG canvas with a predefined path representing an events/calendar icon.
Accept a `fill` prop to set the path's fill color.
Forward any `class` attribute to the `<path>` element via `$attrs.class`.

functions.name: defineProps
functions.description: Vue `<script setup>` helper that declares component props.

fill.description: CSS color value used to fill the SVG path.

analysis.usage:
Import the component where needed, then use it in a template. For example:

```js
import IconEvents from "modules/icons/entities/IconEvents.vue"
```

```html
<IconEvents fill="#007acc" class="my-icon-class" />
```
notes: No `<style>` block is defined; styling is driven by the `fill` prop and external CSS classes.
The component relies on CSS variables (e.g. `--black`) for default color, ensure they are defined in the global stylesheet.
Any additional attributes passed (besides `fill`) will be forwarded to the `<svg>` root via `$attrs`, but only `class` is specifically applied to the `<path>`.
Since it's a purely presentational component, it has no internal state or lifecycle hooks.
